title: Exposed point
summary: In mathematics, an exposed point of a convex set C {\displaystyle C} is a point x ∈ C {\displaystyle x\in C} at which some continuous linear functional attains its strict maximum over C {\displaystyle C} . Such a functional is then said to expose x {\displaystyle x} . There can be many exposing functionals for x {\displaystyle x} . The set of exposed points of C {\displaystyle C} is usually denoted exp ⁡ ( C ) {\displaystyle \exp(C)} .
